domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith If this is a statistical survey (e.g. Generalised Random Tessellation Strarified GRTS) then it is entirely appropriate for assessing rivers & far more useful than "ad-hoc" or "representative" sampling where it us unclear how samples relate to wider set (population) of rivers.

@AndyBackAgain @GreenGreenwich @beckettrankine @ana_captures @CharltonCSE7 @XRGreenwich @SilvertownTn @pedalmeapp @livingstreets @TransportActio2 @Royal_Greenwich @TfL @EnvAgency @mtpennycook @SadiqKhan @Heidi_LDN I know what you mean, its a UK wide problem. We just pay twice as much as other European countries(like the Netherlands) for the same thing. Fact is that if this bridge was officially chosen after a year the predicted cost will go up to £600m+ and then get cancelled.
